type.description: Type of computational environment that can be automatically setup after downloading the model.
type.title: Type

file_paths.description: List of file paths that contain the the environment description, relative to the repository root. E.g., for 'conda', it could be ['environment.yml'].
file_paths.title: File Paths

ComputationalResources.description: Computational resources need for a hybrid model or component.
ComputationalResources.title: ComputationalResources

type.description: Conda computational environment that can be automatically setup after downloading the model.
type.title: Type

file_paths.description: List of file paths that contain the conda environment description, relative to the repository root. E.g., 'environment.yml'.
file_paths.title: File Paths

Data.description: Data structure for input and output data.
Data.title: Data

DataIO.description: Collection of input and output data for a hybrid model.
DataIO.title: DataIO

created.description: Date when the hybrid was created. (e.g. 2000-12-31).
created.title: Created

description.description: Summarized description of the hybrid model. Can be formatted with HTML tags.
description.title: Description

hidden.description: Indicates whether the hybrid model is hidden within the FRAME library. Hidden models remain accessible if their ID is known.
hidden.title: Hidden

id.description: Short name that serves as unique identifier for the hybrid model. Should be all lowercase and contain no spaces (use "_" instead) or special characters.
id.title: Id

keywords.description: List of keywords that describe the hybrid model.
keywords.title: Keywords

name.description: Full name of the hybrid model.
name.title: Name

documentation.description: List of URLs or DOIs for documentation.
documentation.title: Documentation

readme.description: URL to a Markdown README file.
readme.title: Readme

type.description: Julia computational environment that can be automatically setup after downloading the model.
type.title: Type

file_paths.description: List of file paths that contain the julia environment description, relative to the repository root. E.g., 'Project.toml', 'Manifest.toml'.
file_paths.title: File Paths

description.description: Summarized description of the component. Can be formatted with HTML tags.
description.title: Description

created.description: Date when the component was created (e.g. 2000-12-31). If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's creation date.
created.title: Created

id.description: Short name that serves as unique identifier for the component. Should be all lowercase and contain no spaces (use "_" instead) or special characters.
id.title: Id

keywords.description: List of keywords that describe the hybrid model. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's keywords.
keywords.title: Keywords

contributors.description: List of contributor names. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's contributors.
contributors.title: Contributors

documentation.description: List of URLs or DOIs for documentation. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's list of documentation.
documentation.title: Documentation

identifier.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI). If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's DOI.
identifier.title: Identifier

license.description: License short name. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's license.
license.title: License

readme.description: URL to a Markdown README file. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's README URL.
readme.title: Readme

url.description: Repository URL. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's repository URL.
url.title: Url

version.description: Semantic version. If not provided, will be filled with the associated hybrid model's version.
version.title: Version

MachineLearningComponentReference.description: Reference to an existing machine learning component.

id.description: ID of a component defined in another metadata file, that is compatible with the hybrid model defined in this file. Only the ID is required, the other fields should not be set.
id.title: Id

file_paths.description: List of file paths that contain the python environment description, relative to the repository root. E.g., 'requirements.txt', 'pyproject.toml'.
